Class Report

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Report

  • public class Report
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of class Report represents a report.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alessandro Giovannacci

    • Constructor Detail

      • Report

        public Report(Geolocation g,
              java.util.Date d,
              ReportReason rr)
        It builds a new report with the specified parameters. The non-specified parameters are automatically set up. By default, when a report is created, it has not been taken over yet, and the name of the user who has taken over it is not specificated. Furthermore, the status of the report is automatically set, and also the reportID.
        Parameters:
        g - the coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the report.
        d - the local time and date of the report.
        rr - the reason of the report.

    • Method Detail

      • getTakenOverBy

        public java.lang.String getTakenOverBy()
        It returns the userID of the person that has taken over the report. If the report has not been taken over yet, it returns the string "n/a".
        Returns:
        the string which represents the userID of the user, or "n/a" if not taken over.

      • getReportID

        public int getReportID()
        It returns the reportID of the report.
        Returns:
        the reportID of the report.

      • getCoordinates

        public Geolocation getCoordinates()
        It returns the coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the report.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the report.

      • getTime

        public java.util.Date getTime()
        It returns the time and date of the report.
        Returns:
        local time and date of the report.

      • getReportReason

        public ReportReason getReportReason()
        It returns the reason of the report.
        Returns:
        the reason of the report.

      • getReportStatus

        public ReportStatus getReportStatus()

        Returns:

      • getReportCounter

        public static int getReportCounter()
        It returns the value of the counter of the reports.
        Returns:
        the value of the counter of the reports.

      • getTakenOver

        public java.lang.String getTakenOver()
        It returns the string "YES" if the report has been already taken over, "NO" otherwise.
        Returns:
        the string "YES" if taken over, "NO" if not taken over.

      • setReportsCounter

        public static void setReportsCounter(int n)
        It sets the value of the counter of reports.
        Parameters:
        n - the value to give to the counter of the users.
